<a href="https://www.wendys.com/breakfast?utm_source=display&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=breakfast&utm_content=199_croissant#199-croissants" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Wendy's" style="width:100%;max-width: 124px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="124" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby83OTMvMTYzMTA0NDg3Ny1XYXZlX1JlZF9DTVlLLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0="></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>An interesting trend to start off your day: The share of people expecting to work past the age of 62 dropped to 50.1% in the latest NY Fed survey, the lowest level on record. The other 49.9% must have let their parents throw out their rare Pokémon cards.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Welp, lesson learned. Have a great Wednesday (yes, it's Wednesday already).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">— <em>Neal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Sherry Qin</em></p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEALS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/07/dealmaking-ma-ipos-track-break-records-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's the Deal...With All the Deals?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/07/dealmaking-ma-ipos-track-break-records-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NEW YORK, NY - SEPTEMBER 12:  Jerry Seinfeld performs during the GOOD + ..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MzEzL2dvb2RfZm91bmRhdGlvbl9hbl9ldmVuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Manny Carabel/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A most excellent question, considering corporate deals of all kinds, from takeovers to IPOs, are happening at a record-setting pace this year.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Mergers and acquisitions</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">M&A activity <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/deals-deals-deals-banks-feast-on-merger-bonanza-11631007002?mod=hp_lead_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit $1.8 trillion</a> in the US and $3.6 trillion globally through the first eight months of the year, according to Dealogic data cited by the WSJ. That’s on track to break the record set in 2015. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>With most of the uncertainty created by the pandemic in the rearview, companies are strategizing for the long-term, either by adding scale or gaining exposure to newer industries. A few examples: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>AT&T spun off its WarnerMedia division and </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/warner-bros-discovery-will-be-name-of-media-colossus-formed-in-merger-11622567102?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">combined it</a></span><span> with Discovery to better compete in the streaming wars. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Square planted a flag in the growing “buy now, pay later” sector by </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/08/01/square-to-buy-buy-now-pay-later-giant-afterpay-in-29b-deal/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquiring Afterpay</a></span><span> for $29 billion. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>John Deere bought a Silicon Valley robotics startup to </span><span><a href="https://www.themanufacturer.com/articles/john-deere-acquires-silicon-valley-robotics-firm-for-250m/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accelerate</a></span><span> its development of autonomous farm equipment.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the banks that advise on these deals, life is <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/smiling-face-with-sunglasses_1f60e.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">. Goldman Sachs made $1+ billion in M&A fees each of the past three quarters, a level it only topped once in the 10 years before Covid-19 hit. The dealmaking surge is one of the main reasons Goldman is the best performing stock in the Dow this year, up 56%. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">IPOs</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2021 has been the <a href="https://www.axios.com/wall-street-ipo-flood-419d87ba-749d-459c-9086-941d65b1ddf6.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosprorata&stream=top" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">busiest year for IPOs</a> since 2000, according to Axios. 279 companies have IPO’d in the US this year, easily beating last year’s total of 218. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Side note: That number doesn’t even include public offerings via SPACs, which have increased to 423 so far this year from 248 in 2020. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>because it’s hard to get much work done in Mykonos, August was its typical slow self for dealmaking. But get ready for a deluge of announcements once bankers head back to their monitors this fall, including potential IPOs from Chobani, Discord, Reddit, Instacart, and Rivian. <em>– NF</em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/07/new-apple-iphones-announced-next-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple Sends “Save the Date” for New iPhones
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/07/new-apple-iphones-announced-next-week?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Apple invite for its hardware event" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MzE0L2FwcGxlX2ludml0ZV9mb3JfaXRzX2hhcmR3YXJlX2V2ZW50LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s spilling the details on its iPhone 13 lineup—unless Tim Cook’s too superstitious to name it that—on Sept. 14. Yesterday, the company sent out invites for its annual (and still virtual) launch event where it’ll announce <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/07/apple-sends-invites-for-september-14-launch-event-new-iphones-expected.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new products</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The new phone lineup isn’t expected to feature <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-10/apple-readies-new-iphones-with-pro-focused-camera-video-updates?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major changes</a> like last year’s design overhaul and 5G upgrade, according to Bloomberg. But content creators (aka everyone on Instagram) should be stoked. Some rumored updates:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A new A15 chip for faster browsing, scrolling, etc.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Professional editor-level photo and video resolution.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The despised black bar, or “notch,” at the top of the previous iPhone models’ screens will get smaller.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A portrait mode-like feature will come to video recording, so you can blur out any evidence your fancy restaurant pic was taken at The Cheesecake Factory.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple could also use the event to announce new AirPods, Apple Watches, and <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-stock-is-making-an-impressive-move-into-the-new-i-phone-reveal-173701881.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">streaming content</a> or devices for Apple TV+.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Apple’s had a better pandemic than nap dresses, recently rising above a $2.5 trillion market cap. What it announces next Tuesday will show where the company is focusing its efforts heading into 2021’s holiday shopping season and beyond. <em>– JW</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/ford-poaches-senior-executive-doug-field-apples-car-project?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ford Gets Its Bronco
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="ford bronco goats" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjYyL2ZvcmRfYnJvbmNvX2dvYXRzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.freep.com/story/money/cars/ford/2021/01/09/ford-bronco-sport-goats-tv-commercial/6582393002/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Detroit Free Press</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And now for some news Apple definitely won’t send any invites over: Ford has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/07/ford-hires-ex-tesla-apple-executive-doug-field-to-lead-advanced-tech.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">poached</a> the executive who led Apple’s secretive car project to become its own “chief advanced technology and embedded systems officer.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That executive is Doug Field, who’s basically to high-tech cars what banana peppers are to sandwich toppings—one of the GOATs. Field was at Tesla to help launch the bestselling Model 3, and is considered one of the key figures in a new era where automobiles rely nearly as much on software and the cloud as they do axles and steering wheels. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ford is </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>pumped</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">.</strong> CEO Jim Farley called the hire a “watershed moment for our company” as it pivots to electric and self-driving cars.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple is the opposite of pumped—let’s go with gutted. Its car project, known as Titan, has gone through many ups and even more downs since it began in 2014. Losing Field could set a release back further, and may even “spell the end” of Apple’s car ambitions, the Financial Times <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/45dc9e63-733a-430b-9e3f-926294f93901?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggests</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Toyota announced a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/batteries-solid-opportunity-evs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$13.5 billion investment</a> in the development of next-gen batteries for EVs. And sign up for <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=emtech&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Emerging Tech Brew</a> for all the EV news your heart desires. — <em>NF</em></p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY WENDY'S
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Three Tastiest Words Ever
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.wendys.com/breakfast?utm_source=display&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=breakfast&utm_content=199_croissant#199-croissants" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Wendy's" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/4169/1630605889-CFB_199800x600.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.wendys.com/breakfast?utm_source=display&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=breakfast&utm_content=199_croissant#199-croissants" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Wendy’s. Breakfast. Croissants</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s say that again, together, with <em>feeling</em>: <strong style="color:#000">Wendy’s. Breakfast. Croissants</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Made with fresh-cracked egg, a hot, buttery, flaky croissant, and your choice of oven-baked bacon or grilled sausage, these toasty tasty treats tantalize totally.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dang we got so excited we started to alliterate. But prepare yourself for what is truly HEADLINE NEWS: <a href="https://www.wendys.com/breakfast?utm_source=display&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=breakfast&utm_content=199_croissant#199-croissants" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Wendy’s Bacon, Egg and Swiss and Sausage, Egg and Swiss. Croissants. Are. Only. $1.99</a>. Each.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And since we know we are talking to some Certified Morning People™, let us assure you that other than reading this here e-newsletter there is no better start to the day than with a $1.99 Bacon, Egg and Swiss or Sausage, Egg and Swiss Croissant.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So yeah, there’s a new breakfast queen in town. And she’s got red hair, pig tails, and a metric ton of breakfast croissants with your name on them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This morning, we ask only that you <a href="https://www.wendys.com/breakfast?utm_source=display&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=breakfast&utm_content=199_croissant#199-croissants" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">choose wisely, choose Wendy’s</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/college-university-fall-higher-education-men-women-enrollment-admissions-back-to-school-11630948233?mod=hp_lead_pos10" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gender gap</a> among college students is growing. Women accounted for a record 59.5% of college students at the end of the 2020–2021 school year, while men made up just 40.5%. This year could bring even wider disparities: For the 2021–2022 school year, women sent in 3.8 million college applications, compared to men’s 2.8 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“If Ms. Spears wants to terminate the conservatorship and believes that she can handle her own life, Mr. Spears believes that she should get that chance.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a surprise court filing, Britney Spears’s father and the conservator of her estate, Jamie Spears, asked a judge to <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/07/entertainment/britney-spears-conservatorship-petition-to-end/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">end the 13-year conservatorship</a> that Britney has called “abusive” and left the singer with little control over her own life. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/07/death-life-nycs-financial-district?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Death and Life of NYC’s Financial District
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/07/death-life-nycs-financial-district?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NYC's Financial District" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MzA3L255Y19zX2ZpbmFuY2lhbF9kaXN0cmljdC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Photo by <a href="https://unsplash.com/@jennieramida?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jennieramida</a> on <a href="https://unsplash.com/s/photos/financial-district-new-york?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Unsplash</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Leading up to the anniversary of the September 11 attacks this Saturday, we’ll feature stories that explore the economic impact of 9/11, 20 years later.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Watch any episode of <em>Billions </em>or <em>Succession </em>and you’re bound to see multiple tracking shots of lower Manhattan, showcasing the district as a global hub for finance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These days, that’s not the case. New York City’s financial district, which was devastated when the World Trade Center towers fell, has undergone a transformation in the last 20 years that many say has been mostly positive for the area—it now has a more diverse industry base, an influx of residents, and greater tourism. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>On the eve of 9/11, the Financial District (FiDi), <em>was</em> a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-9-11-attacks-remade-new-york-citys-financial-district-11630501200?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finance hub</a>. 55% of office tenants in downtown Manhattan were in finance or insurance, according to the Downtown Alliance. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the years after the attacks, many banks left the neighborhood, primarily for Midtown. But FiDi didn’t empty out. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Companies in sectors like media—including Spotify, Condé Nast, and at one point, Morning Brew—</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/04/nyregion/9-11-lower-manhattan-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">established offices there</a></span><span>, offsetting the loss of finance workers.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, more people made FiDi their actual home. The neighborhood’s residential population has more than doubled since 2000, according to a WSJ analysis. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Covid-19 pandemic has presented fresh challenges for lower Manhattan, with a major downturn in the number of commuters and tourists hurting local businesses. <em>– NF</em></p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA most excellent question, considering corporate deals of all kinds, from takeovers to IPOs, are happening at a record-setting pace this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMergers and acquisitions\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eM\u0026A activity \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/deals-deals-deals-banks-feast-on-merger-bonanza-11631007002?mod=hp_lead_pos5\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit $1.8 trillion\u003c/a\u003e in the US and $3.6 trillion globally through the first eight months of the year, according to Dealogic data cited by the WSJ. That’s on track to break the record set in 2015. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eWith most of the uncertainty created by the pandemic in the rearview, companies are strategizing for the long-term, either by adding scale or gaining exposure to newer industries. A few examples: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAT\u0026T spun off its WarnerMedia division and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/warner-bros-discovery-will-be-name-of-media-colossus-formed-in-merger-11622567102?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecombined it\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with Discovery to better compete in the streaming wars. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSquare planted a flag in the growing “buy now, pay later” sector by \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/08/01/square-to-buy-buy-now-pay-later-giant-afterpay-in-29b-deal/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacquiring Afterpay\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for $29 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eJohn Deere bought a Silicon Valley robotics startup to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.themanufacturer.com/articles/john-deere-acquires-silicon-valley-robotics-firm-for-250m/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccelerate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its development of autonomous farm equipment.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the banks that advise on these deals, life is \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/smiling-face-with-sunglasses_1f60e.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e. Goldman Sachs made $1+ billion in M\u0026A fees each of the past three quarters, a level it only topped once in the 10 years before Covid-19 hit. The dealmaking surge is one of the main reasons Goldman is the best performing stock in the Dow this year, up 56%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIPOs\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2021 has been the \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/wall-street-ipo-flood-419d87ba-749d-459c-9086-941d65b1ddf6.html?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosprorata\u0026stream=top\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebusiest year for IPOs\u003c/a\u003e since 2000, according to Axios. 279 companies have IPO’d in the US this year, easily beating last year’s total of 218. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSide note: That number doesn’t even include public offerings via SPACs, which have increased to 423 so far this year from 248 in 2020. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ebecause it’s hard to get much work done in Mykonos, August was its typical slow self for dealmaking. But get ready for a deluge of announcements once bankers head back to their monitors this fall, including potential IPOs from Chobani, Discord, Reddit, Instacart, and Rivian. \u003cem\u003e– width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple’s spilling the details on its iPhone 13 lineup—unless Tim Cook’s too superstitious to name it that—on Sept. 14. Yesterday, the company sent out invites for its annual (and still virtual) launch event where it’ll announce \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/07/apple-sends-invites-for-september-14-launch-event-new-iphones-expected.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew products\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe new phone lineup isn’t expected to feature \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-10/apple-readies-new-iphones-with-pro-focused-camera-video-updates?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor changes\u003c/a\u003e like last year’s design overhaul and 5G upgrade, according to Bloomberg. But content creators (aka everyone on Instagram) should be stoked. Some rumored updates:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA new A15 chip for faster browsing, scrolling, etc.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eProfessional editor-level photo and video resolution.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe despised black bar, or “notch,” at the top of the previous iPhone models’ screens will get smaller.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA portrait mode-like feature will come to video recording, so you can blur out any evidence your fancy restaurant pic was taken at The Cheesecake Factory.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple could also use the event to announce new AirPods, Apple Watches, and \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-stock-is-making-an-impressive-move-into-the-new-i-phone-reveal-173701881.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estreaming content\u003c/a\u003e or devices for Apple TV+.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eApple’s had a better pandemic than nap dresses, recently rising above a $2.5 trillion market cap. What it announces next Tuesday will show where the company is focusing its efforts heading into 2021’s holiday shopping season and beyond. \u003cem\u003e– JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoached\u003c/a\u003e the executive who led Apple’s secretive car project to become its own “chief advanced technology and embedded systems officer.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat executive is Doug Field, who’s basically to high-tech cars what banana peppers are to sandwich toppings—one of the GOATs. Field was at Tesla to help launch the bestselling Model 3, and is considered one of the key figures in a new era where automobiles rely nearly as much on software and the cloud as they do axles and steering wheels. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFord is \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003epumped\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e.\u003c/strong\u003e CEO Jim Farley called the hire a “watershed moment for our company” as it pivots to electric and self-driving cars.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple is the opposite of pumped—let’s go with gutted. Its car project, known as Titan, has gone through many ups and even more downs since it began in 2014. Losing Field could set a release back further, and may even “spell the end” of Apple’s car ambitions, the Financial Times \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/45dc9e63-733a-430b-9e3f-926294f93901?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggests\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eToyota announced a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/batteries-solid-opportunity-evs?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$13.5 billion investment\u003c/a\u003e in the development of next-gen batteries for EVs. the anniversary of the September 11 attacks this Saturday, we’ll feature stories that explore the economic impact of 9/11, 20 years later.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWatch any episode of \u003cem\u003eBillions \u003c/em\u003eor \u003cem\u003eSuccession \u003c/em\u003eand you’re bound to see multiple tracking shots of lower Manhattan, showcasing the district as a global hub for finance.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese days, that’s not the case. New York City’s financial district, which was devastated when the World Trade Center towers fell, has undergone a transformation in the last 20 years that many say has been mostly positive for the area—it now has a more diverse industry base, an influx of residents, and greater tourism. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eOn the eve of 9/11, the Financial District (FiDi), \u003cem\u003ewas\u003c/em\u003e a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-9-11-attacks-remade-new-york-citys-financial-district-11630501200?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinance hub\u003c/a\u003e. 55% of office tenants in downtown Manhattan were in finance or insurance, according to the Downtown Alliance. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the years after the attacks, many banks left the neighborhood, primarily for Midtown. But FiDi didn’t empty out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCompanies in sectors like media—including Spotify, Condé Nast, and at one point, Morning Brew—\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/04/nyregion/9-11-lower-manhattan-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestablished offices there\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, offsetting the loss of finance workers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus, more people made FiDi their actual home. The neighborhood’s residential population has more than doubled since 2000, according to a WSJ analysis. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Covid-19 pandemic has presented fresh challenges for lower Manhattan, with a major downturn in the number of commuters and tourists hurting local businesses. \u003cem\u003e– NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
